course_title: Principles of Midwifery & Woman Centred Care

learning_outcomes.description: Apply the frameworks, governance, organization and decision making points of antenatal, intrapartum, and postpartum care within the context of midwifery care in Australia and contrast with global maternity care.

Interpret the inherent qualities and role of a midwife in the establishment of relationships when caring for the woman, as well as those necessary when engaging in professional relationships with other health care practitioners.
Illustrate the legal and professional requirements for midwifery practice across the woman's experience during the antepartum, intrapartum, and postpartum continuum.

Explore factors that contribute to a positive pregnancy, birth experience and postpartum transition, for the woman, newborn and family, following a holistic physical and psychological approach to environment, support, assessment and monitoring, introducing communication and digital technologies.
Explain the importance of woman-centred care based on the midwifery principles of partnership, continuity of care, culturally safe practice and holism.

assessments.due_date:
18/03/2025 - 6/05/2025

Presentations will occur in weeks 4, 6, 8, and 10 during IBL classes.
assessments.task_description: Assessment item 1: In groups of three (3) students are to provide a presentation on a chosen topic that addresses an antenatal or intrapartum issue.  Please refer to the task description and marking rubric within the Blackboard site for more detail.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit an electronic copy of this assessment to BlackBoard. Please visit the companion BlackBoard site for the link to upload.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students are to complete a written assignment surrounding normal birth. Please refer to the task description and marking rubric within the Blackboard site, for more detail.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit an electronic copy of this assessment to Turnitin via BlackBoard. Please visit the companion BlackBoard site for the link to upload.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This will be a 60 minute (1 hour) Digital on-campus invigilated exam using Inspera.  Please refer to the Blackboard site for more detail.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Online Learning

You are expected to spend seven (7) hours per week on learning for this course. This includes working through the module material provided including preparation for your IBL workshops. Resources can be found in learning resources on the Blackboard site for this course.
